An AIDS patient presents to his primary care physician with a two week history of watery, non-bloody diarrhea. The most likely diagnosis is which of the following?

A 30 year old female stored her contact lenses in tap water. She noticed deterioration in vision and visited an ophthalmologist, who diagnosed her with keratitis. Culture would likely reveal which of the following?
The diagnostics characteristics of Plasmodium falciparum are best diagnosed by which of the following statements?

options.label: A
options.text: An important diagnostic feature is the irregular appearance of the edges of the infected red blood cell

options.label: B
options.text: A period of 72 hours is required for the development of the mature schizont, which resembles a rosette with only 8 to 10 oval merozoites

options.label: C
options.text: Except in infections with very high parasitaemia, only ring forms of early trophzoites and the gametocytes are seen in the peripheral blood.

options.label: D
options.text: Schuffner stippling is routinely seen in red blood cells that harbor parasites

options.label: E
options.text: The signet ring shaped trophozoites is irregular in shape with amoeboid extensions of the cytoplasm

questions.correct_answer: C. Except in infections with very high parasitaemia, only ring forms of early trophzoites and the gametocytes are seen in the peripheral blood.

questions.text: A divorced working mother takes her 4-year-old child to day care center. She has noticed that the child’s frequent stools are non-bloody, foul smelling and fatty. The child has no fever. One should suspect infection with which parasite?
Human infection with beef tapeworm usually is less serious than infection with pork tape worm, because of which of the following statements?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute intestinal obstruction is less common in beef tape worm infection

options.label: B
options.text: Beef tape worm eggs cause less irritation of the mucosa of the digestive tract

options.label: C
options.text: Larval invasion does not occur in beef tape worm infection

options.label: D
options.text: The adult beef tape worms are smaller in size

options.label: E
options.text: Toxic by-products are not given off by adult beef tape worm

questions.correct_answer: C. Larval invasion does not occur in beef tape worm infection

questions.text: Trypanosoma cruzi initially penetrates through the mucous membranes and then multiplies in a lesion known as chagoma. In the chronic stage of the disease, where are the main lesions often observed?

A medical technologist visited Goa and consumed raw fish daily for two weeks. Six months after her return to her home, she had a routine physical examination and was found to be anemic. Her vitamin B12 levels were below normal. What is the most likely cause of her condition?
questions.correct_answer: B. Infection with fish tape worm

An AIDS patient presents to OPD with a 2 months history of watery, non-bloody diarrhea. The stool reveals acid fast oocysts of 6 µm size. All are characteristic except

options.label: B
options.text: Macrolides is the treatment of choice

options.label: D
options.text: Ag detection in stool and direct fluorescence testing are alternative methods of detection

questions.correct_answer: B. Macrolides is the treatment of choice

questions.text: A teenager who works in a dog kennel after school has had a skin rash, eosinophilia and an enlarged liver and spleen for 2 years. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this infection?
Onchocerciasis:

options.label: B
options.text: transmitted by the bite of fly

options.label: C
options.text: is confined to the African continent

options.label: D
options.text: ocular involvement results from lymphatic migration of the parasites

questions.correct_answer: B. transmitted by the bite of fly

questions.text: In Toxocariasis:

options.label: A
options.text: the infestation is acquired from both dogs and cats

options.label: B
options.text: infestation occurs through ingestion of larvae

options.label: C
options.text: intraocular calcification is a common feature of ocular toxocariasis

questions.correct_answer: A. the infestation is acquired from both dogs and cats

questions.text: A 30 year old patient presented with features of acute meningoencephalitis in the casualty. His CSF on wet mount microscopy revealed motile unicellular microorganisms. The most likely organism is

True about toxoplasmosis is all except

options.label: A
options.text: In adults toxoplasmosis is usually asymptomatic

options.label: B
options.text: IgG antibodies are diagnostic in congenital toxoplasmosis

options.label: D
options.text: Encephalitis is uncommon in immunocompetent individuals

options.label: E
options.text: The incidence of transplacental infection is highest in third trimester but the infant is not severely affected

questions.correct_answer: B. IgG antibodies are diagnostic in congenital toxoplasmosis
